studyDesigns.name: Study Design
studyDesigns.rationale: Protocol-defined study design for investigating efficacy and safety

arms.name: AZD7442
arms.description: Single 600 mg dose of AZD7442 administered as 2 separate IM injections of 300 mg each (AZD8895 and AZD1061) on Day 1.

arms.name: Placebo
arms.description: Single IM dose of placebo administered on Day 1.

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 1
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants undergoing intensive testing for virological and immunological status (includes sentinel group).

studyCohorts.name: Cohort 2
studyCohorts.characteristic: Participants followed primarily for clinical outcomes.

studyElements.name: AZD7442 - Screening
studyElements.description: Treatment period for AZD7442 during Screening

studyElements.name: AZD7442 - Treatment and Intensive Follow-up
studyElements.description: Treatment period for AZD7442 during Treatment and Intensive Follow-up

studyElements.name: AZD7442 - Limited Follow-up
studyElements.description: Treatment period for AZD7442 during Limited Follow-up

studyElements.name: AZD7442 - Early Discontinuation Visit
studyElements.description: Treatment period for AZD7442 during Early Discontinuation Visit

studyElements.name: Placebo - Screening
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Placebo during Screening

studyElements.name: Placebo - Treatment and Intensive Follow-up
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Placebo during Treatment and Intensive Follow-up

studyElements.name: Placebo - Limited Follow-up
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Placebo during Limited Follow-up

studyElements.name: Placebo - Early Discontinuation Visit
studyElements.description: Treatment period for Placebo during Early Discontinuation Visit

maskingRoles.text: Subject is masked in this Double Blind study
Investigator is masked in this Double Blind study
Caregiver is masked in this Double Blind study
Data Analyst is masked in this Double Blind study

population.name: Study Population
population.description: Target population defined by eligibility criteria

objectives.name: Primary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: To detect a RRR of in the incidence of severe COVID-19/death in the AZD7442 group compared to the placebo group

objectives.name: Secondary Efficacy Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the efficacy of AZD7442 compared to placebo in the primary analysis population

objectives.name: Safety Objective
objectives.text: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of a single IM dose of AZD7442

endpoints.name: Primary Efficacy Endpoint
endpoints.text: A composite of either severe COVID-19 or death from any cause through Day 29. Severe COVID-19 is characterized by a minimum of either pneumonia (fever, cough, tachypnea, or dyspnea, AND lung infiltrates) or hypoxemia (SpO2 < 90% in room air and/or severe respiratory distress) and a WHO Clinical Progression Scale score of 5 or higher

endpoints.name: Secondary Efficacy Endpoint
endpoints.text: Incidence of severe COVID-19/death in the primary analysis population

endpoints.name: Safety Endpoint
endpoints.text: Safety data through Day 8 from the participants in the sentinel group and monitoring for hypersensitivity reactions

estimands.name: Primary Efficacy Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with COVID-19 at high-risk of progression (modified full analysis set) Summary measure: Relative Risk Reduction (RRR) using CMH method.

intercurrentEvents.name: Treatment discontinuation
intercurrentEvents.text: Participant discontinues study or intervention prior to Day 29

estimands.treatment: AZD7442 600 mg IM single dose vs Placebo
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with COVID-19 at high-risk of progression (modified full analysis set)
estimands.variableOfInterest: A composite of either severe COVID-19 or death from any cause through Day 29
estimands.summaryMeasure: Relative Risk Reduction (RRR) using CMH method

estimands.name: Secondary Efficacy Estimand
estimands.populationSummary: Adult patients with COVID-19 (primary analysis population) Summary measure: Relative Risk Reduction (RRR).

intercurrentEvents.name: Death from any cause
intercurrentEvents.text: Death occurring during the analysis period

estimands.treatment: AZD7442 600 mg IM single dose vs Placebo
estimands.analysisPopulation: Adult patients with COVID-19 (primary analysis population)
estimands.variableOfInterest: Incidence of severe COVID-19 or death

estimands.name: Safety Estimand - Sentinel Group
estimands.populationSummary: First 20 participants dosed (Sentinel Group) Summary measure: Incidence and frequency of adverse events.
estimands.treatment: AZD7442 600 mg IM single dose vs Placebo
estimands.variableOfInterest: Safety data and hypersensitivity monitoring through Day 8
estimands.summaryMeasure: Incidence and frequency of adverse events

instances.name: Auto-anchor for Vaccination Delay for AZD7442

exits.name: Participant Withdrawal
exits.description: Withdrawal at own request or investigator discretion for safety, behavior, or compliance

exits.name: Lost to Follow-up
exits.description: Repeated failure to return for scheduled visits and unable to be contacted after 3 calls and a certified letter

definedProcedures.name: Injection site inspection
definedProcedures.label: Injection Site Check
definedProcedures.description: Monitoring for reactions at the site of IMP administration

definedProcedures.name: Intramuscular injection
definedProcedures.label: IM Injection
definedProcedures.description: Administration of IMP as 2 separate injections in the gluteal region

definedProcedures.name: Pharmacokinetics Assessments
definedProcedures.label: PK Sampling
definedProcedures.description: Serum collection for determination of drug concentration

definedProcedures.name: Pulse Oximetry
definedProcedures.label: SpO2 Measurement
definedProcedures.description: Measurement of oxygen saturation in room air

activities.name: Staff review of participant-reported symptom diary
Study staff-collected mid-turbinate nasal swab for SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR and sequencing

definedProcedures.name: Urine pregnancy test
definedProcedures.label: Pregnancy Test
definedProcedures.description: Local laboratory urine test for females of childbearing potential

activityGroups.name: Laboratory and Biomarkers
activityNames: Study staff-collected mid-turbinate nasal swab for SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR and sequencing

activityGroups.name: Patient Reported Outcomes and Dosing
activityNames: Staff review of participant-reported symptom diary

notes.text: a. Visits noted P/H can be performed either in-person at clinical site or at home depending on the participant's clinical status.
b. Perform if no documentation of SARS-CoV-2 infection available; tested locally.
c. Assessment will be performed only for participants attending in-person visits.
d. Height is recorded only at the screening visit.
e. Perform pre-dose and 15 minutes (+/- 5 minutes) after both injections are complete.
g. Hematology panel includes coagulation markers.
h. Urine pregnancy test (local laboratory) at screening. Perform another urine test on Day 1 if screening test was performed on Day -1.
j. Participants will report COVID-19-related symptoms daily in an electronic device, starting pre-dose and post-dose on Day 1.

indications.name: COVID-19
indications.description: Treatment of COVID-19 in Non-hospitalized Adults

procedures.name: Urine pregnancy test
procedures.label: Pregnancy Test
procedures.description: Local laboratory urine test for females of childbearing potential

procedures.name: Intramuscular injection
procedures.label: IM Injection
procedures.description: Administration of IMP as 2 separate injections in the gluteal region

procedures.name: Injection site inspection
procedures.label: Injection Site Check
procedures.description: Monitoring for reactions at the site of IMP administration

procedures.name: Pharmacokinetics Assessments
procedures.label: PK Sampling
procedures.description: Serum collection for determination of drug concentration

procedures.name: Pulse Oximetry
procedures.label: SpO2 Measurement
procedures.description: Measurement of oxygen saturation in room air

analysisPopulations.name: All participants analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: All participants screened for the study, to be used for reporting disposition and screening failures.
analysisPopulations.label: PAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: All participants screened for the study, to be used for reporting disposition and screening failures.

analysisPopulations.name: Full analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: All randomized participants who received IMP, irrespective of their protocol adherence and continued participation in the study. Participants will be analyzed according to their randomized treatment, irrespective of whether or not they have prematurely discontinued, according to the intent-to-treat principle. Participants who withdraw consent or assent to participate in the study will be included up to the date of their study termination.
analysisPopulations.label: FAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: All randomized participants who received IMP, irrespective of their protocol adherence and continued participation in the study. Participants will be analyzed according to their randomized treatment, irrespective of whether or not they have prematurely discontinued, according to the intent-to-treat principle. Participants who withdraw consent or assent to participate in the study will be included up to the date of their study termination.

analysisPopulations.name: Modified full analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: All participants in the full analysis set who received IMP  7 days from symptom onset and were not hospitalized at baseline ( Day 1) for isolation purpose.
analysisPopulations.label: mFAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: All participants in the full analysis set who received IMP  7 days from symptom onset and were not hospitalized at baseline ( Day 1) for isolation purpose.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In FAS AND received IMP <= 7 days from symptom onset AND not hospitalized at baseline for isolation

analysisPopulations.name: Early Intervention Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: All participants in the modified full analysis set who received IMP  5 days from symptom onset.
analysisPopulations.label: EIAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: All participants in the modified full analysis set who received IMP  5 days from symptom onset.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In mFAS AND received IMP <= 5 days from symptom onset

analysisPopulations.name: Seronegative Analysis Set
analysisPopulations.text: All participants in the modified full analysis set who were seronegative at baseline.
analysisPopulations.label: SAS_Sero
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: All participants in the modified full analysis set who were seronegative at baseline.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In mFAS AND seronegative at baseline

analysisPopulations.name: Safety analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: The safety analysis set consists of all participants who have received IMP. Erroneously-treated participants (eg, those randomized to treatment A, but were actually given treatment B) are accounted for in this analysis set by assigning them to the treatment they actually received.
analysisPopulations.label: SAF
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The safety analysis set consists of all participants who have received IMP. Erroneously-treated participants (eg, those randomized to treatment A, but were actually given treatment B) are accounted for in this analysis set by assigning them to the treatment they actually received.

analysisPopulations.name: PK analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: Dosed participants for whom an adequate (measurable drug concentration) PK profile has been obtained. All participants who received AZD7442 and from whom PK blood samples are assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations, and who had at least one quantifiable serum PK observation post dose, will be included in the PK analysis dataset.
analysisPopulations.label: PKAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: Dosed participants for whom an adequate (measurable drug concentration) PK profile has been obtained. All participants who received AZD7442 and from whom PK blood samples are assumed not to be affected by factors such as protocol violations, and who had at least one quantifiable serum PK observation post dose, will be included in the PK analysis dataset.
analysisPopulations.criteria: Received AZD7442 AND evaluable PK profile AND >=1 quantifiable post-dose PK observation

analysisPopulations.name: Virology analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: The Virology analysis set consists of all participants in Cohort 1, who undergo more intensive virologic and immunologic assessments. Participants will be analyzed according to their received treatment.
analysisPopulations.label: VAS
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The Virology analysis set consists of all participants in Cohort 1, who undergo more intensive virologic and immunologic assessments. Participants will be analyzed according to their received treatment.

analysisPopulations.name: ADA evaluable analysis set
analysisPopulations.text: The ADA evaluable analysis set contains all participants in the Safety analysis set who have a non-missing baseline AZD7442 ADA result and at least one non-missing post-baseline AZD7442 ADA result.
analysisPopulations.label: ADA
analysisPopulations.populationDescription: The ADA evaluable analysis set contains all participants in the Safety analysis set who have a non-missing baseline AZD7442 ADA result and at least one non-missing post-baseline AZD7442 ADA result.
analysisPopulations.criteria: In Safety Set AND non-missing baseline ADA result AND >=1 non-missing post-baseline ADA result

Severe COVID-19 is characterized by a minimum of either pneumonia (fever, cough, tachypne"}]

Perform if no documentation of SARS-CoV-2 infection available; tested locally.", "c. Assessment will be performed only for participants attending in-person visits.", "d. Height is recorded only at the screening visit.", "e. Perform pre-dose and 15 minutes (+/- 5 minutes) after both injections are complete.", "f. Perform pre-dose on Day 1.", "g. Hematology panel includes coagulation markers.", "h. Urine pregnancy test (local laboratory) at screening. Perform another urine test on Day 1 if screening test was performed on Day -1.", "i. Urine pregnancy test (local laboratory).", "j. Participants will report COVID-19-related symptoms daily in an electronic device, starting pre-dose and post-dose on Day 1."]

titles.text: A Phase III Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study to Determine the Safety and Efficacy of AZD7442 for the Treatment of COVID-19 in Non-hospitalized Adults
Phase III Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study of AZD7442 for Treatment of COVID-19 in Outpatient Adults

type.decode: US FDA Investigational New Drug Application Number

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Age requirement
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant must be  18 years of age inclusive at the time of signing the informed consent.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: SARS-CoV-2 infection confirmation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant who has a documented laboratory-confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection, as determined by a molecular test (antigen or nucleic acid) from any respiratory tract specimen (eg, oropharyngeal, NP, or nasal swab, or saliva) collected  3 days prior to Day 1.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: WHO Clinical Progression Scale score
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: WHO Clinical Progression Scale score > 1 and < 4.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Symptom onset timing
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Participant must be dosed with IMP no more than 7 days from self-reported onset of COVID-19-related symptoms (mild to moderate COVID) or measured fever, defined as the self-reported date of first reported sign/symptom from the following list: Subjective fever or feeling feverish; Cough; Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing at rest or with activity; Sore throat; Body pain or muscle pain/aches; Fatigue; Headache; Chills; Nasal obstruction or congestion; Nasal discharge; New loss of taste or smell; Nausea or vomiting; Diarrhea; Documented temperature > 37.8C/100F; New onset confusion (only for participants  60 years old); Appetite loss or decreased food intake (only for participants  60 years old); Increased supplemental oxygen requirement (only for participants on baseline supplemental oxygen).

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Current symptoms
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: One or more of the following signs/symptoms must be present within 24 hours prior to Day 1: Cough; Sore throat; Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing at rest or with activity; Body pain or muscle pain/aches; Fatigue; Headache; Chills; Nasal obstruction or congestion; Nasal discharge; Nausea or vomiting; Diarrhea; New loss of taste or smell.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Oxygen saturation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Oxygenation saturation of  92% obtained at rest by study staff within 24 hours prior to Day 1, unless the potential participant regularly receives chronic supplementary oxygen for an underlying lung condition.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Trial participation restriction
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Agrees not to participate in another clinical trial for the treatment of COVID-19 or SARS-CoV-2 during the study period until reaching hospitalization or 28 days post-entry, whichever is earliest.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prior COVID-19 vaccine or mAb
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any prior receipt of investigational or licensed vaccine or other mAb/biologic indicated for the prevention of SARS-CoV-2 or COVID-19 or expected administration immediately after enrollment

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Mechanical ventilation
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Current requirement for mechanical ventilation or anticipated impending need for mechanical ventilation.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Bleeding disorder
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Clinically significant bleeding disorder (eg, factor deficiency, coagulopathy, or platelet disorder), or prior history of significant bleeding or bruising following IM injections or venepuncture.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Other significant disease
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any other significant disease, disorder, or finding that may significantly increase the risk to the participant because of participation in the study, affect the ability of the participant to participate in the study, or impair interpretation of the study data.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Allergy or hypersensitivity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Known allergy/sensitivity or any hypersensitivity to components of the IMP or placebo.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent surgery or life-threatening comorbidity
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Any co-morbidity requiring surgery within 7 days prior to study entry, or that is considered life-threatening in the opinion of the site investigator within 30 days prior to study entry.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Prohibited medication
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Use of any prohibited medication listed in Section 6.5 within 30 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to study entry.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Convalescent plasma
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Receipt of convalescent COVID-19 plasma treatment at any time prior to study entry.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Steroid use
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Receipt of systemic steroids (eg, prednisone, dexamethasone) or inhaled steroids within 30 days prior to study entry unless a stable dose used for a chronic condition.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent IMP receipt
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Receipt of any IMP in the preceding 90 days or 5 half-lives, whichever is longer, or expected receipt of IMP during the period of study follow-up, or concurrent participation in another interventional study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Investigator judgment
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Judgment by the investigator that the participant should not participate in the study if the participant is unlikely to comply with study procedures, restrictions, and requirements.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Previous randomization
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Previous randomization in the present study.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Pregnancy or breastfeeding
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: For women only, currently pregnant (confirmed with positive pregnancy test) or breast feeding.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Recent blood draw
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Blood drawn in excess of a total of 450 mL (1 unit) for any reason within 30 days prior to randomization.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Sponsor or site staff
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: Employees of the Sponsor involved in planning executing, supervising, or reviewing the AZD7442 program, clinical study site staff, or any other individuals involved with the conduct of the study, or immediate family members of such individuals.

eligibilityCriterionItems.name: Lack of capacity for consent
eligibilityCriterionItems.text: In nations, states, or other jurisdictions that for legal or ethical reasons bar the enrollment of participants who lack capacity to provide their own informed consent, such subjects are excluded.

studyInterventions.name: AZD7442
studyInterventions.description: A combination product of 2 monoclonal antibodies (AZD8895 and AZD1061) for the treatment of COVID-19.

studyInterventions.name: Saline placebo
studyInterventions.description: Visually distinct saline solution administered as 2 separate 3 mL IM injections.

studyInterventions.name: Local standard of care
studyInterventions.description: Background therapy according to participating institution/hospital regardless of randomization group.

studyInterventions.name: Influenza vaccines
studyInterventions.description: Licensed influenza vaccines are permitted at any time.

studyInterventions.name: Allergen immunotherapy
studyInterventions.description: Allowed if participant has been receiving stable desensitization therapy for at least 30 days prior to Day 1.

studyInterventions.name: Commercial biologics/immunosuppressants
studyInterventions.description: Includes prednisone, azathioprine, tacrolimus, cyclosporine, methotrexate, hydroxychloroquine, or cytotoxic chemotherapy if stable on maintenance dose.

studyInterventions.name: SARS-CoV-2 vaccines
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited prior to study entry; restricted during acute illness; requires unblinding and counseling if requested after recovery.

studyInterventions.name: Convalescent COVID-19 plasma
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited at any time prior to study entry.

studyInterventions.name: Systemic or inhaled steroids
studyInterventions.description: Prohibited within 30 days prior to study entry unless a stable dose is used for a chronic condition.

amendments.name: Amendment 6
amendments.summary: The number of primary endpoint events required for the primary analysis has been reduced from 52 to 43 and this will be sufficient to provide 90% power for the primary analysis. The data cut-off for the primary analysis will be 30 days after approximately 43 primary endpoint events have been confirmed. Enrollment will stop when approximately 43 primary events have been confirmed. Analysis populations have been defined to accommodate the clarification of the primary endpoint population and the inclusion of additional supportive estimands. Primary analysis method has been changed from Poisson regression model to CMH method.

medicalDevices.name: Electronic device
medicalDevices.label: eDiary Device
medicalDevices.description: Device used by participants to report COVID-19-related symptoms daily

medicalDevices.name: Emergency kit
medicalDevices.label: Anaphylaxis Kit
medicalDevices.description: Kits for treatment of severe anaphylactic reactions/shock

medicalDevices.name: Pulse Oximeter
medicalDevices.label: SpO2 Monitor
medicalDevices.description: Device used to measure SpO2 levels

medicalDevices.name: Mechanical ventilator
medicalDevices.label: Ventilator
medicalDevices.description: Device for respiratory support (exclusion criteria if required)

conditions.name: Pregnancy Exclusion
conditions.description: Female participants must not be pregnant
conditions.text: Sample urine test must return negative result before dosing

conditions.name: Safety Suspension - Hypersensitivity
conditions.description: Criteria for study suspension based on hypersensitivity
conditions.text: One or more participants experience a grade 4 hypersensitivity reaction or SAE hypersensitivity

conditions.name: Safety Suspension - Injection Site
conditions.description: Criteria for study suspension based on injection site reactions
conditions.text: 2 or more participants within the first 100 experience a grade 3 or higher injection site reaction

study.name: A Phase III Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study to Determine the Safety and Efficacy of AZD7442 for the Treatment of COVID-19 in Non-hospitalized Adults

administrations.name: AZD8895 component
administrations.duration: Administered as a 3 mL injection in the gluteal region

administrations.name: AZD1061 component
administrations.duration: Administered as a 3 mL injection in the gluteal region

administrations.name: Placebo administration
administrations.duration: Two separate 3 mL injections in the gluteal region

studyDefinitionDocument.name: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study in Adults for the Post-Exposure Prophylaxis and Treatment of COVID-19 (AZD7442)

transitionRules.name: Screening to Randomization
transitionRules.text: Verify eligibility criteria and documentation of SARS-CoV-2 infection

transitionRules.name: Dose Modification Restriction
transitionRules.text: Dose modification is not permitted unless in case of discontinuation of IMP; re-challenge is not permitted

transitionRules.name: Unblinding for Vaccination
transitionRules.text: Participants may be unblinded if they wish to be vaccinated after recovery from COVID-19

commentAnnotations.text: The potential impact of AZD7442 on COVID-19 vaccines is not known and has not been studied.
commentAnnotations.sourceSection: Table 5 Summary of Permitted, Prohibited, or Restricted Medications

commentAnnotations.text: In case a participant shows an AST or ALT >= 3 x ULN together with TBL >= 2 x ULN please refer to Appendix D.
Sexual abstinence is considered a highly effective method only if defined as refraining from heterosexual intercourse during the entire period of the study.

studyDefinitionDocumentVersions.description: Phase III Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multicenter Study to Determine the Safety and Efficacy of AZD7442

studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated guidance on participant unblinding for the purpose of receiving COVID-19 vaccinations and subsequent study participation.
Clarified the process for unblinding participants who wish to be vaccinated.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To provide clinical guidance and counseling for participants wishing to receive a SARS-CoV-2 vaccine after recovery from COVID-19.
To address potential interference between AZD7442 monoclonal antibodies and vaccine-induced immune responses.

studyChanges.afterText: Participants may wish to be vaccinated. If so, they may be unblinded as to their randomized investigational treatment in this study as per study unblinding procedure (Section 6.3.3), counselled, and referred outside the study for possible vaccination.
studyChanges.summary: Added provision for unblinding participants for vaccination purposes.

studyChanges.afterText: Unblinded participants who received AZD7442 should be advised to consider waiting an appropriate length of time (9 to 12 months) before receiving an anti-SARS-CoV-2 vaccine.
studyChanges.summary: Specified waiting period for vaccination for participants in the AZD7442 arm to avoid potential interference.

studyChanges.afterText: Participants who have been unblinded in order to receive vaccination can and should remain in the study after being unblinded.
studyChanges.summary: Confirmed that unblinded participants should continue study follow-up.
